intro: Eryngium schiedeanum, commonly known as the Schiedea eryngium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage and showy purple to violet flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun. Eryngium schiedeanum is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
